column2: caption=Elrohir from ''[[The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game]]''

column1: '''Elrohir''' and his twin brother [[Elladan]] were the children of [[Celebrían]] and [[Elrond]]. Dark-haired and grey-eyed, only those that knew them well could tell them apart.

The brothers were tall, dark-haired and grey-eyed, and so much alike that only those that knew them well could tell them apart. To [[Meriadoc Brandybuck]] their elven-fair faces seemed neither old nor young. While in the [[Grey Company]] they wore cloaks of silver-grey over a bright mail.<ref name="PassingGreyCompany"/>

column2: 2509}}, the twins' mother Celebrían went on a journey into the south to visit her own mother, [[Galadriel]], in the land of [[Lothlórien
column3: Lórien]]. In the [[Redhorn Pass]], she was captured by orcs, and tortured in their dens. Elrohir rode with his brother to rescue her, but by the time they reached her she had received a poisonous wound.<ref name="TA"/>  Though their father healed her, she would not remain in [[Middle-earth]], and sailed into the [[Aman
column4: West]] the following year. After this loss, Elladan and Elrohir were filled with hatred of the [[orcs]], often riding against them with the [[Northern Dúnedain]].

column1: In the early part of the [[War of the Ring]], the brothers' main role was to scout the land and prepare the way for the [[Fellowship of the Ring
column3: II1}}</ref> but later they took a more active part. When [[Halbarad]] rode to [[Aragorn
column4: Aragorn's]] aid with the [[Grey Company]], Elladan and Elrohir accompanied them. They followed Aragorn through the [[Paths of the Dead]], fought with him at [[Pelargir]], and took part in the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]], where they fought with stars bound to their brows.

column1: After the [[War of the Ring]], little is known of the brothers' fate. They returned to their father's house at [[Rivendell]], and remained there even after he had passed across the Sea.<ref>{{FR
column2: Records}}</ref> Like their sister [[Arwen]], the sons of Elrond [[Half-elven]] were granted the choice of whether to leave Middle-earth for the [[Undying Lands]], or remain there and become [[Mortals
column3: mortal]] as [[men]]. So they chose for a time at least, to stay in Middle-earth for reasons unknown.

column1: <div style="overflow-x: scroll; overflow-y: hidden; border: 1px solid #AAAAAA; padding: 3px; background: #EEEEEE;">
In earlier editions, the year {{TA}} 139 is given as the twins' birthdate.<ref>Cf. for example {{HM
column2: Guide}}, entries for Elladan and Elrohir.</ref>

column1: :Elrohir and Elladan follow [[Halbarad]] and come to [[Aragorn]]'s aid. No actor is credited.
'''2001-2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game]]'':'''
:Despite not featuring in [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)
column2: ''The Lord of the Rings'' film series]], Decipher produced a card depicting the character.

column1: '''2011: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]]'':'''

:Elrohir and Elladan, as in many other adaptations, look very similar. But unlike Elladan, Elrohir wears a helmet.
Elrohir and Elladan were sent by their father, [[Elrond]], to [[Fornost]], to scout the city for enemies. Here they meet [[Eradan (video game character)
column3: Farin]], who were sent by [[Aragorn]] to stop [[Agandaûr]]'s army from attacking. The collaborate with each other, as they have the same goal, and fight a way to the Citadel of the city.<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]], Chapter 1: Fornost, ''Inner wards''</ref> There, Elrohir and his brother remove the [[Magic
column4: magic spell]] of the Citadel gate, which protects Agandaûr against intruders.<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]], Chapter 1: Fornost, ''The Citadel''</ref> Inside the citadel, Eradan, Andriel and Farin kill [[Tharzog]] - leader of the [[Orcs]] - while Elladan and Elrohir fight Agandaûr. During the fight Agandaûr has the upper hand. But when Eradan, Farin and Andriel arrive, Agandaûr flees on the back of a [[Fell beast]]. Elladan and Elrohir return to [[Rivendell]], where Elrond is informed about the events in Fornost.<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]], Chapter 1: Fornost, ''Citadel tower''</ref>
